title: prince andrew must now give
story: Exclusive: Prince Andrew must now give up military titles, says Iraq War hero colonelColonel Tim Collins is the first military ex-chief to comment publicly on the Andrew allegations and says prince should jump before he is pushed by embarrassed royal familyAndrew has a wealth of military honours Image: Press AssociationBySean Rayment:,  Jan Iraq war hero Colonel Tim Collins has become the first senior former officer to publicly call on Prince Andrew to give up his honorary military titles. He said the sex allegations surrounding the Duke of York and his links to the late paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein and convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell were “embarrassing for everyone”. The former commanding officer of the Royal Irish Regiment – of which Andrew is Colonel-in-chief – also said the royal should “jump before he is pushed”. Col Collins, , whose inspirational eve-of-battle speech to his battalion in  won him worldwide attention, is the first former military chief to comment publicly on the allegations against Andrew – which the Prince denies. He met the Duke in his honorary role – one of his nine military titles – around the time of the Iraq War.  Col Collins, who also served in the SAS, said the best course of action the Duke could now take to save the Royal Family from further embarrassment is to resign his military titles. The Belfast-born ex-officer said: “The publicity surrounding [Prince Andrew] is embarrassing for everyone. “It is entirely up to him and what he decides to do at the end of the day. “He will listen to advice from the rest of the royal family, he’s got his own mind, it’s going to be better for everybodyhe took the decision and jumped rather than was pushed. “I don’t think he’ll ever ride the storm out. That is the bottom line because I think that the damage has been done.  “I think it’s a question of timing and I think that he’ll decide to jump or some more senior members of the royal family will say you’ve got to go. “There is one of two ways this could have gone – you either go immediately and say I’ll clear my name and come back, which is the right thing to do ­always or try, and tough it out. “If you tough it out, you better hope to God that you come out of it. “The most likely outcome, in my opinion, is that he will be cleared and then at that point it will be the right point for him to say, ‘I haven’t been convicted of anything but the detritus around it means that I should make way for a younger royal in respect of the people I am Colonel-in-chief of’. “I don’t think we will have to wait very many weeks for that to happen.” Col Collins, who received the OBE from Prince Charles in  for his ­service in Iraq, wasalso scathing about Andrew’s ­disastrous ­interview on BBC’s Newsnight in .Andrew is being sued in a US court by Virginia Giuffre, , who alleges she was forced to have sex three times with him in  when she was , including once in London. The Duke strongly denies all of her allegations. During the BBC interview, he claimed he could not have sexually assaulted Ms Giuffre – who claims he was sweating profusely as they danced in a London nightclub – because he “doesn’t sweat” and was dining in a pizza restaurant at the time of the alleged offence. Col Collins said: “Every person who I know who advised him said do not do that BBC interview, do not enter into any litigation and say nothing. “Ninety-nine per cent of people condemn themselves out of their own mouth and he dug a bloody big hole with that interview.”  The Sunday People has also learnt that a serving senior officer is planning to write to Andrew calling on him to give up all his military titles. A source has claimed that the officer believes the Prince is in denial about the damage he is causing to the reputation of the military. Senior defence sources have also said that there is no support or sympathy for the Duke at the most senior armed forces ranks. Col Collins spoke out after the Sunday People revealed last week the Queen will reluctantly strip her son of military titleshe does not resign. The move is likely to be a devastating blow to Her Majesty, who was said to be deeply upset after Prince Harry was forced to stand down from his role as Captain General of the Royal Marines last year because he had given up other royal duties.  But defence sources say the Army’s most senior commanders believe it is now impossible for the Duke to continue in his role as the Colonel-in-chief of nine military regiments, units and corps. Andrew currently holds the honorary title of Colonel of the regiment in the Grenadier Guards and is the Colonel-in-chief of the  th Lancers, the Royal Irish Regiment, the Yorkshire Regiment, the Small Arms School Corps and Royal Colonel of the Royal Highland Fusiliers. He is also Honorary Air Commodore of RAF Lossiemouth, Commodore-in-chief of the Fleet Air Arm and Admiral of the Sea Cadet Corps. The Ministry of Defence and the Palace declined to comment. Last night Andrew, , was anxiously awaiting a ruling from Judge Lewis Kaplan over whether he will face a full civil court case over Ms Giuffre’s allegations. It was reported yesterday that one of the witnesses in the Maxwell trial claims Ms Giuffre told her she had slept with Andrew in London. Carolyn Andriano, , who waived her right to anonymity, said Ms Giuffre texted her from London in March  to say she was going for dinner with Andrew, Maxwell and Epstein. She also claimed Ms Giuffre had shown her the infamous picture of her posing with Andrew at Maxwell’s home. Ms Giuffre is alleged to have shown the picture to Carolyn back in Florida, saying of the Prince: “I got to sleep with him.” Carolyn reportedly said: “She didn’t seem upset about it. She thought it was pretty cool.” Maxwell, , was found guilty last month of child sex trafficking and could face up to  years in a US jail. Depraved Epstein was found dead in his cell in , aged , while ­awaiting trial. news uk-news prince-andrews-final-bid-end-"Prince Andrew addresses Virginia Giuffre’s allegations in ByRussell MyersRoyal EditorChristopher BucktinUnited States Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  Desperate Prince Andrew is plotting a last-ditch bid to have the civil rape case against him thrown out as it was claimed his accuser will refuse any offer of an out-of-court settlement.Virginia Giuffre, who alleges she was forced to have sex with Andrew when she was , is said to want a trial to send a message that anyone “with power and privilege” accused of abusing young girls will face justice. New York judge Lewis Kaplan’s decision on whether the Duke will face a full civil trial is expected soon. He has already decided there is no case to answer on the “domicile ­argument” over Ms Giuffre’s residency in Australia but a source has told the Mirror that Andrew’s legal team “are not taking this lying down”.  His lawyers believe they have found a new angle to stop Ms Giuffre’s case, as federal law explicitly bans two parties who are not US residents facing each other in court. The source said: “They believe they have a genuine argument to get this thrown out. If they can prove under federal law where Ms Giuffre has filed her case, that there is precedent not to bring a case where both parties are not US residents, then it should be halted immediately.” Ms Giuffre, who claims she was trafficked by billionaire paedophile Jeffrey Epstein and his partner Ghislaine Maxwell, and forced to have sex with the Duke on three occasions in , has lived in Australia since . Our source said: “Eventhe judge rules that there is a case for a full trial, there is a long way to go.”  The Duke’s attorney, Andrew Brettler, said Ms Giuffre was living in a £million home in Perth, Australia, when she filed her lawsuit and had spent less than two years in the US since moving to Australia in . The claimant’s team has a deadline of January  to prove -year-old Ms Giuffre’s residency status. Prince Andrew’s former we Sarah, , today declared it was “onwards and upwards” as she ed from a skiing holiday in Verbier, Switzerland, at the £million chalet the Duke is having to sell to pay his legal bills, which have topped £million. The Duke has always “absolutely and categorically” denied the allegations against him. But the Queen will not pay her son’s costs and “would not assist” him in paying a financial ­settlement to Ms Giuffre.  It has been claimed a million – £.million – out of court settlement would be turned down by Ms Giuffre, leaving the Duke at risk of a far higher payouther case goes ahead in the autumn and is settled by a jury. Previously, Spencer Kuvin, a lawyer for some of Epstein’s victims, told the MirrorAndrew is found guilty the damages could “easily” top £million. He said: “A jury is not limited by anything. To punish somebody worth a billion dollars, you have got to hit them in their pockets and punish them accordingly.” If Judge Kaplan does decide that the case should go to trial, insiders have said the option to settle out of court “remains on the table”. One source said: “No discussions have been had regarding a financial settlement – the Duke wants to clear his name. “This is a US civil litigation, being fought in a US court with US lawyers – and given that the vast majority of US civil litigation is settled out of court, it would always remain an option on the table.” Read MoreRead MoreFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Ghislaine MaxwellPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal FamilyCrimeBillionairesDaily Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: prince andrews skype calls very
story: Exclusive: Prince Andrews Skype calls with very upset Beatrice and Eugenie after he quit ski tripPrince Andrew was advised it would be inappropriate to join the trip as he awaits a ruling on whether he will face a civil court case over allegations he sexually abused Virginia GiuffrePrince Andrew stayed at home as his family went skiing after his team advised him it would be inappropriate Image: BBCBySarah RobertsonPatrick HillNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew was advised not to slope off on his family’s ski holiday – fearing the publicity would add to an avalanche of woes. With the world’s eyes on a possible civil court case over sex abuse claims in the US, the Duke of York stayed at home. He was literally a virtual recluse – using Skype for video calls to his people in Verbier, Switzerland. We can reveal he had daily chats with daughters Beatrice and Eugenie and the rest of the party. A source told the Sunday Mirror: “Beatrice and Eugenie were both very upset because they were hoping their children would be able to spend their first ski holiday with their grandad and the entire family. “Sadly it wasn’t to be, but they did hold Skype calls with their father nearly every day while they were in Verbier so that they could support him and he could see the grandchildren on holiday.” Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter  It is claimed Andrew, , had been due to fly out with the group. It included ex-we Sarah Ferguson, sons-inlaw Edo Mapelli Mozzi, , and Jack Brooksbank, , plus grandson August,  months, and three-month-old granddaughter Sienna. But the Duke got cold feet after his team advised him it would be “inappropriate” for him to be seen on holiday while facing sex allegations. And Andrew’s former pal Ghislaine Maxwell, , has just been convicted in New York of sex trafficking for Jeffrey Epstein – further complicating any ski jaunt for Andrew.  The Duke is anxiously awaiting a US ruling from Judge Lewis Kaplan on whether he will face a full civil court case over allegations he sexually abused Virginia Giuffre on three occasions in , when she was aged . He vehemently denies the claims. Beatrice, , and Eugenie, , put aside the strain to enjoy the two-week ski break, before flying back from Geneva to Heathrow on Friday. Our source said: “Beatrice and Eugenie fully support their father and are a very close family unit, which includes Sarah. “It’s more about them being there for him and supporting him as opposed to questioning him about the case. That’s not what the family is focused on – it’s about survival, protecting the family name and getting through it in one piece. The girls feel their father’s name is continually dragged through the mud unnecessarily, when really he is a good egg.  “They feel the whole thing is an unfortunate business and they don’t believe their father deserves what is happening to him.” The royal party stayed at Andrew and ex-we Fergie’s £million Swiss chalet. But it could be the family’s final visit as it understood the ski-loving prince is trying to sell the lodge as he faces spiralling legal bills. He and Fergie, , bought it from millionaire French socialite Isabelle de Rouvre for £.million in . But it has been reported they still owe £.million and that legal threats were issued last year after claims of a missed a payment in December . It is believed Andrew and Fergie agreed to sell the seven-bedroom property to a wealthy European investor last September, but the deal has still not been completed.  Andrew and Fergie orced in  but they remain close and have been living under the same roof at Royal Lodge, Windsor, since . The Duke had Christmas lunch with the Queen at Windsor Castle, when sources say he was in “good spirits” after his legal team reportedly told him they believed Maxwell was likely to be cleared. But just four days later she was convicted. Then – hours after the ski party ed home – the Duke suffered a new blow with publication of a testimony from one of Maxwell’s victims. Waiving her right to anonymity, Carolyn Andriano, , claimed Andrew’s accuser Ms Giuffre had texted her in March  to say she was going for dinner in London with Andrew, Maxwell and Epstein. She also alleged Ms Giuffre, now , later showed her the infamous picture of herself with Andrew inside Maxwell’s London mews house.  Carolyn, who was abused by Epstein and Maxwell from the age of , added: “I asked hershe’d been to the Palace. And she said, ‘I got to sleep with him’. “I said, ‘What  You’re f****** with me’, and she said, ‘No, I got to sleep with him’. She didn’t seem upset. She thought it was pretty cool.” The claims came six days after the Sunday Mirror’s exclusive interview with Anthony Figeruoa,  – Ms Giuffre’s boyfriend in . He said Virginia told him she “didn’t want to do it” – referring to sex with Andrew. Anthony says she was “scared” by what Epstein and Maxwell wanted her to do. Andrew has always denied the allegations. ButMs Giuffre’s court case gets the go-ahead and she wins, legal experts predict she could get a £million settlement. She is said to want her day in court to send a message that anyone “with power and privilege” accused of abusing young girls will face justice. The Prince still faces the prospect of being questioned by US authorities investigating links to Epstein. Florida-based lawyer Spencer Kuvin, who represents a number of Epstein victims, told the Mirror: “He now has two close friends convicted, so it should make him very concerned about his future. “I believe the best way forward for him now is to settle. I would tell him he needs to get this case sorted out and fast.” On Friday it emerged the Queen will not pay Andrew’s legal bills, now £million, or any potential settlement. But he has assured her he is innocent and she still backs him. title: schoolgirl 8 rare condition dreams
story: Schoolgirl, , with rare condition dreams of walking down the aisle as a bridesmaidThere is now new hope for Amelie after she was offered le-changing surgery that will give her the best chance of walking unaided and without her walking frameAmelie Round has Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Image: Mercury Press  MediaByChloe CawoodGraeme Murray:,  Jan | commentsA schoolgirl with a rare condition wants to fulfil her dream of walking down the aisle as a bridesmaid. Amelie Round was diagnosed with Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia- which affects her lower body muscles, causing them to be tight and weak - four years ago. After years of struggling, there is now new hope for Amelie as she has been offered le-changing surgery in Missouri, US, that will give her the best chance of walking unaided - but the family need £,. The eight-year-old dreams of being able to walk independently and joining her sister, Saphie, four, as a bridesmaid for her parents. Her parents, Rose Moore,  and Jay Round,  of Hessay, York, plan to renew their wedding vows for their ten-year anniversary after the operation. Rose said: “After the surgery, the hope is the girls would be bridesmaids. “Amelie could independently walk down the aisle, which is something she couldn’t do now.” The pair were delighted when they welcomed their first child into the world eight years ago.  Until Amelie was -months old, they believed their daughter was developing perfectly. However Amelie did not walk like her other friends and appeared to be very unsteady on her feet, prompting a long road of tests and invasive investigations. By age four, she was given the devastating diagnosis of a lelong motor neurone condition known as HSP. Rose said: “Itaposs a rare condition that affects only around .% of the population The condition affects her lower body muscles, causing them to be tight and weak. “It makes it incredibly dficult for her to walk and balance is a real struggle,I leave her for a second, she just falls. “She also has weak motor skills. There isn’t really one thing which is easy for her.” After the news and arrival of their second child, Saphie, Amelie and Jay felt overwhelmed and as they adapted their lives and home to Amelie’s needs. The pandemic also had a signicant effect on the family and Rose had to give up her job as a solicitor to take care of the girls. Rose said: “It’s really exhausting because we have to watch her constantly. “There’s the emotional side too. It’s really hard watching her struggle.” Although she attends four physiotherapy sessions a week, the eight-year-old lives in constant pain. Rose said: “She gets upset because she doesn’t understand why she has to do her stretches. “She doesn’t understand why her mummy is making her do something that hurts her.”  Because her condition is so rare, Amelie’s parents struggled to find much information online. Rose said: “After the diagnosis we joined so many online forums and support groups to ask questions. “I don’t know what we would have done without them.” Every day, Amelie has to use a walking frame and wears ankle splints. This exhausts her and she struggles signicantly to play with her friends and little sister, who she adores. Amelie is sadly not eligible for this surgery in the UK, however Dr Park in St Louis Childrenaposs Hospital, Missouri is confident the operation will change her le for the better. Rose said: “For a lot of children it’s absolutely le changing and has miraculous results. “Ultimately it’s going to sever the nerves in her spinal cord – the ones that are telling the muscles to be tight in her legs.” “There will be a long rehabilitation process afterwards, but we are hopeful and optimistic.” However, the procedure is costly. Dozens of generous donors have contributed to a GoFundMe page for the brave girl. £, is needed to fund the procedure and give Amelie the opportunity to live her le as independent as possible. Her family are now hoping to raise money to give their young daughter this chance of to transform her le. So far, nearly £, has been raised and the family are overwhelmed with the support and generosity of their friends. To reach their goal, the eight-year-old’s family and friends plan to participate in some active fundraisers in Spring. Rose said: “We like to do a lot of community-based stuff and things Amelie can be involved in.” “We even want to do a danceathon then Amelie can join in in her own way” “She would love to perform in a dance show one day.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON HospitalsWeddings" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: scientists name shopping most perilous
story: Shopping named most risky activity for catching Covid - see full risk listNew data from SAGEs Virus Watch Study found that going to shops once a week meant people were nearly . times more likely to contract the virus late last yearDoing a weekly shop carried the highest Covid risk, SAGE scientists found Image: Western MailByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsDoing a weekly shop carried the highest risk of catching Covid late last year, new data shows. Estimates from SAGEaposs Virus Watch Study - based on the daily activities of , people - found that outdoor sports was the activity with the second-highest chance of infection. But this could be linked to social activities linked to sports as well as taking part in physical activity, researchers said. Visiting pubs, restaurants and using public transport were also highlighted as activities which carried an increased risk of contracting the virus before the Omicron iant took hold. The study found that going to shops once a week meant people were nearly . times as likely to contract the virus. Going to a pub, restaurant and using public transport meant people were . times as likely to test positive for Covid between September and November last year. Outdoor sport carried a risk level of . per cent, the study - which has yet to be peer-reviewed - found.Unsurprisingly those who had to leave their home for work were more likely to contract Covid- than those who did not. However, experts were unable to present reliable data showing how risky going to the cinema, concerts or nightclubs was. According to the Virus Watch Study, the activities which carried the highest risk of infection were:Shopping - .% Playing a sport outdoors - .% Using a bus - .% Eating at a restaurant or cafe - .% Using public transport more than once a week - .% Going to a pub, bar or club - .% Going to a party - .% Going to a gym or indoor sports - .% Leaving home for work - .% Using a taxi - .% Using an overground train or tram - .%However there was no good evidence to show how risky going to theatres, cinemas, concerts or sports events were.  The same was true for going to hairdressers, barbers, nail salons or beauty salons. The data was collected before the Omicron iant began ripping through the UK in December. Today - more than , cases were confirmed by the Department of Health, bringing the seven day total to . million infections. A further  people have died from Covid- - bringing the UKaposs official death toll past ,.The tragic figure, the highest daily number since February last year, according to the Department of Healthaposs daily dashboard, means , lives have been lost to coronavirus since the start of the pandemic.It means the UK is just the seventh country to pass the devastating landmark, following the USA, India, Brazil, Mexico, Russia and Peru. Professor Andrew Hayward, who advises the Government as part of SAGE, said the UK recording more than , deaths after positive Covid tests were absolutely tragic.After hearing the testimony of a woman who lost two close relatives during the pandemic, the University College London academic told BBC Radio aposs PM programme: It is absolutely tragic and to think thataposs been repeated so many times is awful.I think we could have done better. I think some of the deaths are even more tragic for the fact that many of them were avoidablewe had acted earlier in the first and second wave. title: two new regions emerge omicron
story: Two new regions emerge as Omicron epicentres with Covid cases in London slowing downCovid is surging in areas in the north-west and north-east of England with three of the five UK areas with the biggest week-on-week rises in case rates in Middlesbrough, Copeland and Redcar  ClevelandStaff at a school process students Covid- lateral flow tests Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByTed Hennessey:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  “Concerning” rates of the Omicron Covid iant are being detected in the north-east and north-west of England, amid concern over healthcare staffing and hospital admissions. Figures showed that three of the five UK areas with the biggest week-on-week rises in Covid case rates are Middlesbrough , Copelandand Redcar  Cleveland .Dr Mike Tildesley, from the University of Warwick highlighted these regions, along with the Midlands, as areas of concern. He said cases in London are slowing down, but scientists need two weeks to seethis continues.And he said Omicron is possibly the first ray of light in ensuring Covid- becomes endemic and easier to live with, similar to the common cold.Dr Tildesley told Times Radio on Saturday: Most other parts of the country are about two to three weeks behind where London is in their epidemic profile. Particularly concerning is the North East and the North West -you look at hospital admissions in those two regions they are going up, also the Midlands, where I live, thataposs also a little bit concerning, so it is a worry.  On the slightly more positive side, so it doesnapost sound all doom and gloom, what we are seeing from hospital admissions is that stays in hospital do appear to be on average shorter, which is good news, symptoms appear to be a little bit milder, so this is what we are seeing consistently with the Omicron iant. In the Midlands, Northamptonshire leaders declared a system-wide major incident on Friday due to Covid-.Northamptonshire Local Resilience Forum, which is made up of NHS organisations, local authorities, Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service and Northamptonshire Police, issued the alert due to rising demand on services and staffing levels. However, Dr Tildesley added that Omicron is possibly the first ray of light in ensuring Covid- becomes endemic and easier to live with, similar to the common cold.He said: The thing that might happen in the future is you may see the emergence of a new iant that is less severe, and ultimately, in the long term, what happens is Covid becomes endemic and you have a less severe version. Itaposs very similar to the common cold that weaposve lived with for many years. Weaposre not quite there yet, but possibly Omicron is the first ray of light there that suggests that may happen in the longer term. It is, of course, much more transmissible than Delta was, which is concerning, but much less severe.  Hopefully, as we move more towards the spring and we see the back of Omicron, we can get more inter-relationship of living with Covid as an endemic disease and protecting the vulnerable. Any iant that does emerge which is less severe, ultimately, in the longer term, is where we want to be. It comes as as the armed forces have stepped in to fill a staffing crisis in the NHS caused by the rapid spread of the iant. NHS England data shows , NHS staff at hospital trusts in England were absent for Covid- reasons on January , up % on the previous weekand more than three times the number at the start of December . According to the Health Service Journal , staff absences across the entire NHS, including mental health trusts and other areas, for any reason including Covid-, may be as high as ,. In total, there are around , armed forces available on standby.  As well as a staffing crisis, hospitals are also facing the highest number of admissions from coronavirus since last February.A total of , people were in hospital in the UK with Covid- as of January , Government figures show. This is up % week on week and is the highest number since February  . During the second wave of coronavirus, the number peaked at , on January  . The Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisationhas advised the Government against giving a second booster dose, or fourth jab, to care home residents and those aged over , after figures showed it is % effective against admission to hospital. Experts are looking to prioritise the rollout of the first booster dose, as well as encouraging unvaccinated people to come forward for their jabs. Asked on Times Radiojabs would be needed every year, Professor Adam Finn, a professor of paediatrics at University of Bristol and a member of the JCVI said: I think thataposs quite a likely possibility. And I think you know, what weaposve got at the moment, vaccines are great in terms of their ability to prevent serious disease with the current iants. But as weaposve seen that protection doesnapost last all that long, and it doesnapost cross-protect against new iants as they arrive. So we need to go on improving the vaccines available. And we need to go on adjusting what weaposre doing all the time in the face of what comes up next,you like, so itaposs very much an open question as to what we will do. But I think use of vaccines against coronavirus is just going to be with us in the future. Yes, for sure. news weird-news grieving-woman-mortied-after-texting-"TikTok user texts her sisters old number after her deathByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA grieving woman who recently lost her sister comforted herself by texting her siblingaposs number - but it had been reassigned and she got a cruel response from the new owner.Faith Sidman shared a video to TikTok, where she uploads to the account @faithsidman, saying how for two years she has sent messages to her sister, saved as aposSissyapos in her phone. Then she text her in July, and wrote aposthinking about you lots today, I love youapos - and was shocked when she got a reply, asking her to stop texting, as the Daily Star reports. It emerged that the telephone number had been reassigned to a business and it appears the owner had no sympathy for Faith. What do you think about the companyaposs reply  Let us know in the comments... Faith shared a video that included screenshots of the conversation, and the first one to the number was on July . On July , a text was sent back that bluntly reads: You have the wrong number. Faith replies with: Iaposm sorry, my sister passed away two years ago and I still text her from time to time. I thought the number was out of service, I wonapost text anymore.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Ignoring Faithaposs apology and heartbreaking explanation, the person texts back: This was a business. Please stop texting. The video has been watched more than . million times since Faith uploaded it on Wednesday, January , with the caption: At least I got to see her name pop up on my phone one last time. One viewer was horried and commented: I just know your heart dropped seeing her name pop up...I’m sorry baby. A second told her: I could only imagine the emotions when you saw ‘she’ texted you back and to open up the message to them being snarky. I’m so sorry. I would have sent the coldest, nastiest message back, wrote a third, Someone  commented: They could’ve just blocked you so you can keep texting. Meanwhile, other users said Faith should out the company in question so they would have the opportunity to complain. Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: i kicked sister newborn out
story: I kicked my sister and her newborn out after she tried to steal my sons roomA man has been forced to kick his sister and her newborn baby out his home after she tried to kick his sons out their bedroom and steal it for herselfThe mans sister has been going through a tough time lately Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A dad has been left feeling emotionally conflicted, after letting his sister and her newborn baby move in with him, only for her to try and steal his sonsapos room.The man, , has two six-year-old twin boys who share a room, and so he offered his own bedroom to his sister, , who was forced to leave her own home after finding out her boyfriend had been cheating.My sisteraposs going through a good time right now. She gave birth to my niece, Mia, five weeks ago, then found out her boyfriends been cheating on her the whole time and got the other woman pregnant too. She left their place with Mia and she asked methey could stay with us a few days, he wrote on Redditaposs AITA forum.My place is pretty small so only place I could offer is the living room, as I have six-year-old twin boys and they share their room. My sister wanted their room but I told her that’s their own space.  The man offered his sister his room instead, but she still insisted she wanted the boysapos room as itaposs a lot bigger and she would have a lot more space for the babyaposs things, like the bassinet and changing tables, which led to arguments between the siblings. When I got home yesterday my son Noah was crying because he said his auntie took all their stuff from the room. Their toy chest, some drawers were moved into the hallway. She was trying to fit them into my room. I got so mad I made her put everything back, he continued. I really wanted to help my sister with her dealing with so much already but making one of my kids cry and trying to take their room was enough for me. She was told to leave, but the issue is she has nowhere to stay with a newborn baby. She had to go all the way back home to stay with our parents, and since they live far she had to quit her job which means she no longer has a stable income. She hasnapost stopped telling me Iaposm a terrible brother adding more issues to her le and my nieceaposs. She said she was only staying a few days, she was obviously planning on staying much longer. You offered her your room and it wasnapost good enough for her. You werenapost going to win here, one Reddit user commented. Another added: You offered her a home, up to and including your own bedroom so she could have privacy and space. Beggars cannot be choosers. She has no right to demand anything from you, and trying to take something that you have given her your reasons for not agreeing to is incredibly rude. Your job first and foremost is to parent your own children. And protecting their space and wellbeing is part of that.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. ALTERNATES s _Croyde.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"| commentsLike many couples that appear on Grand Designs, Edward and Hazel short inspired us with their elaborate plans to build a wildly ambitious family home. The incredible home at Down End Point, a renowned beauty spot in North Devon, would see them make a drastic jump from their busy lives in London., with daughters Nicole and Lauren. And it wasnapost any ordinary style home . The five-bedroom house includes a four-storey tower from which inhabitants can gaze across the sea. It was set to include a further four bedrooms in the main body of the house, a sauna, a cinema and a ft glass-edged infinity pool with views over Croyde Bay. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Like every episode of Grand Designs, this one began with a sombre Kevin McCloud wearing a hard hat on site and warning the over-eager couple that they may have overstretched themselves. But Edward confidently told the TV presenter that they would be finished in just  months, and would spend no more than £. million. However, the project ended in disaster as the couple ended up splitting, while the family were plunged into millions of pounds of debt. But now the home has finally gone on the open market - for a whopping £M after Edward Short, , has spent a decade working on Chesil Clf House in a bid to get it up to scratch. The property featured on Channel aposs Grand Designs and was described as the saddest episode ever after it aired in October . And Mr Short hasnapost held back on what it has cost him personally, as he told thelast year: There’s no point in regrets, but obviouslyI had any idea of what it would cost the marriage and my family, I wouldn’t have done it. I had started it it’s not easy to back out of this. He added: There were quite a few days where I looked temptingly at the clf edge and thought le might be better down there, but that wouldn’t have helped anyone, would it  I couldn’t give up on that image I had of [the house].”  But despite all the problems, Edward remained adamant he would finish - and now estate agent Knight Frank has now announced the sale of the main house and its annexe known as The Eye. The estate agent described it as one of the most impressive waterfront homes on the North Devon coast. It comprises of five bedrooms and bathrooms, four reception rooms, a sauna and a cellar. The property will also include the three-bedroom studio annexe known as The Eye and double garage.  A Knight Frank spokesperson added: Chesil Clf House is positioned on a three-acre site between surfers’ paradise Saunton Sands backed by the impressive UNESCO Biosphere Reserve of Braunton Burrows, and the idyllic cove of Croyde, beyond which sits National Trust-owned Baggy Point. “Not only does the property boast high design and build quality, it also has a south-facing position and an ease of access to the water with a private beach and foreshore.” Christopher Bailey, Head of National Waterfront, Knight Frank, added: “Chesil Clf House will be the most signicant coastal property to come to the open market in the West Country for many years.  “It is iconic in the true meaning of the word and there is nothing  to compare it to on the market right now. “It certainly sits at the very top of the national coastal waterfront market and I have no doubt it will attract keen interest globally.” Edward said earlier the time was right to move on. He added: I’ll always be proud to have finished this. I owe it to my family to have a real end result, but the time has come to move on. I will have achieved what I set out to do, never deviating from the plans, and for that I’ll always be proud. The house has been anchored into the bed rock of the clf, painstakingly engineered to a level that leaves no possibility for erosional hazard. Edward said he had no option but to sell it to cover the large amount of money he had to borrow. He added: These past ten years have been a marathon slog - and I have got used to being a millionaire in debt. Iaposve accepted the only way forward is to finish and sell it. title: my best friend live together
story: My best friend and I live together with our husbands and kids as one familyBest friends Madison and Curstin both started dating and then marrying two best friends, and even decided to try and get pregnant together, before all becoming one big familyThe couples have been best friends since they started high school Image: @thetwinpletfamily TikTokByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | commentsWhen youaposre younger, the prospect of moving in and growing old with your bestie sounds like the best thing in the world because our friends are our soul mates too.Most of the time, thataposs before weaposve factored in future partners, potentially getting married and certainly having kids - but not for two BFFs.Madison and Curstin have been the best of friends since they were just , and always dreamed of sharing their lives together, but most people assumed that would fizzle out once they settled down with partners. Not long after their friendship blossomed Madison and Curstin started dating two other best friends, Zach and Carter, and amazingly both couples ended up staying together and getting married. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Still the best of friends, the two couples decided to start trying for a baby at the same time, and miraculously, Madison and Curstin fell pregnant within weeks of each other. First, Curstin gave birth to a little boy called Cade, then three weeks later Madison gave birth to twins, Jennings and Evie. And,that wasnapost enough, at the beginning of  the two families decided to take their relationship to the next level and move in together to help Zach adjust when he left the military. Although it was only supposed to be a temporary measure, theyaposve ended up loving raising their families together so much theyaposve decided to make the move permanent. We’re raising our kids together as a family - we created our own little family unit and our babies are so overwhelming loved by so many people because of it,” Madison explained in a TikTok video. Itaposs been an adjustment and probably won’t last forever - but the memories are so worth it. We’re giving our babies a better childhood than we had. We’re best friends raising best friends – it’s been the happiest year of my le.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: my boss asked propose wedding
story: My boss asked to propose at my wedding and I said no - its my wes big dayA man has been forced to tell his own boss he cannot propose to his girlfriend at his wedding because he doesnt want to spoil the big day for his weThe couple are due to get married in two weeks Image: Getty Images EyeEmByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A groom-to-be has found himself in an awkward situation after his boss asked to propose to his girlfriend at their wedding.The man, , knows just how much his fiancée hates when people do things like that, but decided not to ask her, as he thought she might agree against her wishes, just to keep everyone happy. However, when he told his boss no, he started kicking off and accused him of bending to his future we already and warned it would only get worse once they were married. Now, the man has been left feeling awkward, not wanting to put his future we in a dficult situation but also not make le hard for himself at work. Iaposm getting married in two weeks and have invited my boss to the wedding. Yesterday he asked me to tell my we to give her bouquet to his girlfriend - who happens to be one the bridesmaids - instead of throwing it in the air, and then heaposll propose, the groom-to-be wrote on Redditaposs AITA forum. The thing is I can adjust with this, but a few years ago, my fiancée looked at one of these types of videos on Facebook and said aposThis is bad. People shouldnapost even ask the bride to help do this and put her in dilemma.aposMy fiancée is very kind and goes out of her way to help people. Iaposm afraidI tell her sheaposll say yes for her friend against her own wishes. I wanna give her the wedding she deserves. So I said no to my boss without asking her. He got really angry and said I didnapost even ask my we-to-be and I am bending in front of her even before marriage, what will happen when Iaposll get married, etc. He said he would get the perfect scenery for the proposal and all. The man then turned to Reddit to question whether he was wrong to refuse his bossapos proposal request without even asking his future we. Heaposs your boss, not a close relative  friend, so I consider asking to propose at a wedding pretty rude, but he became the a**hole for getting angry at you and insulting you and your we, one Reddit user commented. He just wants a cheap proposal with zero effort. I bet his girlfriend would be mortiedshe knew about his plans to propose at his employee‘s wedding. Another added: Evenyou are good friends, proposing to his girlfriend at your wedding is a no go. Furthermore your soon-to-be we already told you she does not like things like this. There is no reason to p*** of your signicant other just so your boss is happy.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: woman makes history marrying colour
story: Woman makes history by marrying the colour pink - after dating it for  yearsA woman has married the colour pink after dating it for more than  years, in a bizarre ceremony that has made history and is believe to be the first of its kindKitten Kay Sera has married the colour pink after dating it for  years Image: INSTAGRAM @KITTENKAYSERAByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman has made history by marrying the colour pink in a bizarre ceremony - after dating it for more than  years.Kitten Kay Sera is known as aposthe pinkest person in the worldapos and she made headlines in  as it emerged she had spent over £ million on her monochromatic home and wardrobe Now sheaposs taken her obsession a step further, as Kitten has now married the colour, after being inspired by a child she had spoken to. For the ceremony, Kitten wore pink, arrived in a pink Chevrolet, and gave herself a pink ring in what must by the least white wedding in history. What do you think about Kittenaposs unusual wedding  Let us know in the comments... In a post on Instagram, Kitten shared the biggest day of her le with her fans, and she included pictures of her wedding cake, which was topped with a pink swan. She wrote: A very special thank you to @bigsugarbakeshop WOW!!! My wedding cake  cupcakes were fantastic! I am so honored to have you featured at the biggest day of my le! In an interview with KVVU-TV, Kitten said she had dated the colour for four decades but thought now was the right time to make it official. She said she got the idea from a child who mentioned marrying the colour since she loved it so much. Kitten’s love affair began almost by accident on her th birthday, as she was trying to work out what to wear to her party. She settled on a pink top, pink fluffy skirt, pink shoes and pink accessories. Speaking previously, she said: I felt fabulous. I thought,wearing that much pink could make me feel fantastic, why not wear pink every day   Going back to blue jeans and a white T-shirt seemed ludicrous to me. I didn’t want to wait until the next special occasion to feel pink-credible again. I wanted to feel and look pretty in pink every day. I sold my car so I had enough money to leave my hometown of Houston, Texas, and head for the bright pink lights of Hollywood. I like to say I’m a flamingo in a world full of pigeons. When I walk down a busy street during the morning commute, everyone’s wearing grey and black. There’s no expression, no iniduality. Yet people think I’m the crazy one! Over the years, Kitten estimates she has spent over one million pounds on pink paraphernalia and outfits. That sounds like a lot, butyou break it down over the decades, it’s no more than anyone  is spending on cars, sofas and soft furnishings. The only dference is, for me every pound is spent on pink, she says. From the moment you step over the threshold into her pink palace, everything is pink.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news weird-news woman-mortied-after-ordering-boohoo-"TikToker shares hilarious results from BooHoo dress orderByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Online shopping is great, but the one downsize is that every now and then you might get an item of clothing that looks absolutely nothing like it did on the website. Weaposve all been there.But, while most of us have experienced the heartache of buying an out for a night out and it ending up being slightly too big or slightly too small - one womanaposs shopping disaster is in a league of its own. Kara Hall decided to treat herself to a plunging black sequinned wrap dress from Boohoo for her New Yearaposs Eve night out, and it happened to be an absolute bargain at just £... or so she thought. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. When the dress arrived and Kara tried it on, she released it wasnapost just plunging - it actually didnapost even cover the majority of her body.Taking to TikTok from the handle @karahall, Kara asked: What do I do  before adding in the comments section: Raise your handyou’ve been personally victimised by Boohoo Judging by the comments section, it seems like an awful lot of people were raising their hands, as dozens of TikTok users revealed they had also ordered the exact same dress and found the same fault. Nooo way, I ordered this and it looked the exact same on me, I was mortied. I had to send it back, one TikTok user commented, while another added: Omg I bought this too and sent it back for the exact same reason! Fortunately, Kara confirmed she had been able to alter the dress herself in the comments section, meaning it wasnapost a complete waste and she didnapost find herself without a New Yearaposs Eve outfit. news weird-news woman-shares-photo-show-truth-"Influencer shows unrealistic change before and after snapByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments An Instagram influencer has shared a series of before and after snaps to show the reality behind aposperfectapos social media images. Model Nicole Sahebi took to TikTok to share her aposproofapos that social media is fake, as she used a simple trick to completely transform an image, as the Daily Star reports.Sharing the video with her . million followers, Nicole revealed she used the aposFace Appapos editor to change one image, and she said that many influencers use the app. The first image Nicole shared shows how she looks with the filter applied, the second is without the app - and while itaposs a subtle change it completely changes how she looks.What do you think about social media images  Let us know in the comments...In the pictures, Nicole is pictured sitting in a car with a full face of glam, and at first glance, it appeared that Nicole had perfectly applied make-up and plumped lips. However, the model revealed that this was just a filter. She then took off to the effect to show that she actually was completely bare-faced. Nicole shared another sultry snap of fellow model, Mya Ghorbani, in a full face of beauty products where she sported perfectly shaped eyebrows and long eyelashes.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. But, again, this photo is not real despite it looking as realistic as it does. The model took the effect off to reveal that Mya was in fact not wearing any makeup, changing her appearance entirely. The beauty urged her fans that she does not use the app regularly but has just used it to demonstrate how ‘fake’ social media can be. Nicole explained in the comments: Guys! I personally don’t use the app on my pictures. I just wanted to see the dference because so many influencers use it. I paid for it just to see haha but then I cancelled. Stunned at the ‘proof’ of how ‘fake’ social media is, people fled to the comments to react to the video. One person commented: You’re literally soooo pretty without it! Your skin is so flawless. Another user fretted: I can’t trust no one anymore. While a third person voiced: This app should be illegal.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: woman spends 60 spontaneous crooked
story: Woman spends £ on spontaneous crooked tattoo with awkward sexual meaningTattoo lover Mary-Jane Willis has been put off getting inked for le after a spontaneous tattoo turned out crooked and had an awkward double sexual meaningMary-Jane has always loved tattoos Image: TIKTOK @MARYJANENOTKATEByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments An ink-loving young woman has revealed how sheaposll probably never get a tattoo again after a spontaneous tat went drastically wrong.Mary-Jane Willis absolutely loves tattoos, and would most likely have a lot more of them,it wasnapost for an impulsive inking she got one year ago, which left her with bitter regret.The TikToker has two inkings one of which was properly researched, well thought out and that she loves. The other was spontaneous, last minute and a bit of a disaster.Shortly after going to get an impulsive tattoo with her best friend a year ago, Mary-Jane knew sheaposd made a mistake after inspecting it and seeing it was crooked. Not only that, she later learned it also had an awkward sexual meaning, too.  So I love tattoos right, and Iaposd probably go and get one every day of the week,I didnapost have the bad experience I did getting my first impulsive one, she explained in a TikTok posted from her handle @maryjanenotkate.So my first one I had ever got, I planned for months in advance, did a tonne of research. My parents were paying for it so they wanted me to be super educated and made sure I wanted it. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Iaposve almost had it for two years and itaposs like one of those tattoos I know Iaposll love when Iaposm an old lady. You know what I mean  Iaposll be so glad I did it. She continued: But I have this other tattoo that I got a year ago today. Oh my god... I feel like I can kinda laugh about it now but Iaposm still in very much pain because itaposs on my body forever. I had  , my best friend in the passenger seat of my car and an inspiration pic from VSCO. And we drove to this suspicious place and I got a rib tattoo. Not only is it crooked but it has a double sexual meaning. I should not be allowed to have money or responsibilities. After hundreds of TikTok users commented begging to see the tattoo, Mary-Jane posted a follow up clip where she revealed her crooked tattoo. It was a quote that read, they come, they go. Mary-Jane told anyone who didnapost understand the hidden sexual meaning to ask your parents. Oh dear.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: elephant strikes up close friendship
story: Elephant strikes up such close friendship with handler he wont leave his sidePhotographer Sam Turley captured the images at the wildle conservation centre Imire, in Zimbabwe which show elephant Makhavusi and his human handler Marupia who have built up a strong friendshipMakhavusi, a hand-reared elephant, and Marupia, an elephant handler are best friends Image: Sam Turley   CATERS NEWSByJames Leese:,  Jan | commentsElephants never forget, according to the saying – andthat’s true, Makhavusi’s best pal has some making up to do. His human handler Marupia Chivhanga recently ed from a month-long holiday – and Mak has barely left his side since. Photographer Sam Turley, who captured these images of the unlikely friendship, said: “Marupia walked over to Mak and Mak gave him a full inspection with his trunk. Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter  “Marupia then gently placed his forehead on Mak’s front leg and as a greeting, Mak let out the longest, deepest rumble I have ever heard – a greeting I thought was only for the closest of elephant family members.” Marupia, who spends all day every day with -year-old Mak, formed a unique bond with the elephant at wildle conservation centre Imire, in Zimbabwe.  Rescuers saved him from being sold to a zoo as a calf. Sam added: “Mak has formed some incredible relationships with conservancy staff. He visibly enjoys interacting with Marupia and it’s clear the feeling is mutual. “As Mak has never had a herd, Marupia has become a part of his unconventional herd.”Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ZoosElephantsSunday Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. story: People could live to the age of  with new era of supercentenarians, expert claimsAnalysis of data by statisticians in Canada has suggested that the extreme limit of human lespans could be as high as  years old which could burden society-year-old Kane Tanaka is the worlds oldest person currently Image: The Asahi Shimbun via Getty ImagesByGraeme Murray:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan An expert has claimed supercentenarians could live to the age of  with records smashed by . Scientists say people may live until the age of  by the end of the century. And the extreme limit of human lespans, they claim, could see people living until they are -years-old. Data by statisticians at HEC Montréal in Canada reckon people could le far longer lives than the expected three score years and . Léo Belzile has suggested that the record for the oldest person to have lived could be smashed by . And people could be living until -years-old by the end of this century, according to scientists. Data by statisticians at HEC Montréal in Canada has suggested that the extreme limit of human lespans could be as high as -years-old.The current record belongs Jeanne Calment, a French woman who died at the age of  in . Belzile warned that some data suggested there is no upper limit to human lespan. He said: Human lespan lies well beyond any inidual letime yet observed or that could be observed in the absence of major medical advances In the Annual Review of Statistics and Its Applications he said more people pushing lespan limits which could have an huge impact on society. Medical bills could soar as people suffer from extreme old age ailments.  It could also impact social care, pensions and social security payments which would would burden taxpayers. More than a dozen people alive are veried to be currently over the age of  years old.Professor Eileen Crimmins, an le expectancy expert at the University of Southern Calornia, told The Times : aposYouaposre going to have incredible medical bills.aposIf youaposre going to have to make major interventions to keep them alive and healthy, itaposs going to be an incredible expenditure to replace all their knees, all their hips, their corneas, their heart valves. aposWe can probably do this, itaposs like keeping an old car running. But eventually itaposll die.apos The International Database on Longevity - which tracks people who live to at least the age of  - said that the risk of dying increases steadily from the age of  but slows at the age of  and could even level off by the age of . When a person reaches , the chances of dying in the next year reach  per cent. This means that, in some models, an upper lespan limit of - years old is possible. Professor Crimmins added: Nobody has lived beyond . The fact that somebody might live to , OK, fine, whataposs the big deal  If you throw the dice enough times the probability that somebody is going to make it a little longer is always a little bit higher. title: strange moon hut found chinese
story: Mystery of strange Moon hut found by Chinese rover is finally solvedIn December, Chinas national space agency shared a mysterious image taken by the Yutu  lunar rover which has been scouring the dark side of the moon since . The picture showed an out-of-place structure that stumped experts due to its symmetry and flat roof - with the space agency joking it could be an alien abodeA strange blur on the surface of the moon that stumped space watchers is just a rock - new pictures showByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A suspicious-looking structure photographed on the moon by a Chinese rover isnapost an alien abode - itaposs just a small rock shaped like a rabbit. After Chinaaposs lunar Yutu  rover snapped a mysterious cube-shaped blur on the moonaposs horizon in December, researchers from China National Space Administrationapossoutreach program Our Space joked it could be amoon hut .But now the object has been photographed up-close and the images beamed back to earth - and itaposs just a rock. At the time, its out-of-place symmetry and flat roof sent the internet into overdrive, with some speculating it could be alien abode. Experts had suggested it could have been a slab of rubble that broke off as debris after a space impact. The team in charge of the Yutu  Rover dubbed the rock Jade Rabbit due to its appearance and because the Chinese word Yutu translates to jade rabbit.  The Chinese Yutu  mission is the first in history to survey the side of the moon which is always out of sight from the earth. The rover took just one month to arrive on the moonaposs surface in January  after being launched in December . The explorer - which is powered by the sun - landed in the Von Karman crater - part of the Aitken Basin located at the satelliteaposs southern pole. The CSNA said the machine, which periodically shuts down until the sun is out, was clocking speeds of ft-per-hour as it made the long journey to investigate the blur.  Chinese space officials also shared its drive diary, which shows how the team navigate craters as they move over the surface of the rock. Around nine months after its landing, the rover discovered a strange gel-like substance on the far side of the Moon. The substance, which is described as having fascinating colours and a mysterious lustre, was found at the bottom of a small, recent impact crater. title: nfu scotland national conference moved online due to covid 19
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. title: anm group kicks off 150th anniversary celebrations with store cattle sale
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website.
