title: big-jim-braves-freezing-cold-sea-raise-money-local-charities
story: GALA Fairydean Rovers walking footballer Jim Waters braved the freezing cold conditions at Spittal Beach on Boxing Day to help raise much needed funds for a host of local charities.The -year-old was one of the founder members of the team in .And he has been a mainstay in the side ever since, playing in tournaments throughout Scotland and also in Portugal.He now travels from his new home in Berwick to take part in the regular sessions at Netherdale.Last week he offered to take part in the Berwick Boxing Day dip on the proviso that his team-mates made a donation to a local charity of their choice.On Sunday he joined around  hardy souls who turned out for the event with temperatures barely above freezing and a strong, cold wind blowing.Berwick Town Council pulled out meaning there was no official organiser, but Berwick RNLI and North East Ambulance Service were in attendance along with volunteers to ensure that both the fun and safety aspects were catered for.Afterwards Jim told us: “The water was freezing butit persuaded some others to donate to a local charity than it was worth it. It was a good hangover cure though and I’d consider doing it again.”

title: unwanted-christmas-presents
story: ADVICE Direct Scotland, the country’s national advice service, has been running a Christmas campaign to remind shoppers of their consumer rights when ing or exchanging unwanted Christmas gts.From purchasing the wrong size of jumper to receiving two copies of the same book, the post-Christmas period results in lots of requests for refunds or gt swaps.The Consumer Rights Act gives everyone the legal right to either get a refund for goods that are of unsatisfactory quality, unfit for purpose or not as described, or to get a repair – depending on how long the items have been owned.Consumers also have more rights when shopping online and for most online s the regulations state that you can cancel an online order up to  days after receiving it, followed by a -day period in which you can send it back.Consumer rights include:The legal right to either get a refund for goods that are of unsatisfactory quality unfit for purpose or not as described or to get a repair – depending on how long you’ve owned it. From zero to  days, you are entitled to a full refund for goods that are of unsatisfactory quality.For most online s, Consumer Contract Regulations state that you can cancel an online order up to  days after receiving it, followed by a -day period in which you can send your .If you have purchased an item that turns out to be faulty or damaged, your consumer rights entitle you to a full refund within  days. If yourexceeds the -day threshold, then you are no longer covered by the ‘short-term right to reject’ and may only be entitled to a repair, replacement, or partial refund of your item.You are not automatically entitled to the same -day refund with digital purchases such as games, movies or music. Butyour digital purchase does notas advertised, does not play run properly, or is otherwise faulty, you can ask the retailer to repair or replace it.Many shops will accept s of non-faulty items, but there are exceptions including personalised items, perishable goods such as food and flowers, and products that have been worn such as earrings, make-up, toiletries, underwear or swimwear..removeColin Mathieson, spokesperson for Advice Direct Scotland, said: “Even with the best intentions when it comes to buying gts, we can’t always get it right.“From purchasing the wrong size of Christmas jumper to ordering the incorrect colour of phone case, many of us rely on the robust s policies of our favourite retailers, and the ability to swap a gt for something more appropriate when required.“Consumers have extensive rights when it comes to s and refunds, and it is always worth remembering these.“Anyone in Scotland who has any questions about their rights can contact us for free, impartial and practical advice.”Anyone in Scotland who wants more advice on their consumer rights can contact consumeradvice.scot for free on   . Specialist advisers are available from am to pm, Monday-Friday, excluding public holidays.

title: covid-restrictions-now-apply-gyms-libraries-museums
story: All Live Borders activities across their sports, fitness, libraries, museums and venues will have a one-metre physical distancing requirement until  January.The updated guidance may result in some activities and venues having reduced capacity, so where appropriate the charity recommend that customers book in advance to avoid disappointment.Safety of customers and staff remains their priority and they will continue to take the appropriate measures to ensure a safe and spacious environment the existing strict hygiene regimes and improved venue ventilation will continue to keep all activities as safe as is possible.Indoor adultcontact sport and physical activity will not be permitted and Live Borders will be in touch with all those affected by this new guidance.Indoor hospitality venues will reintroduce physical distancingbetween groups .Live Borders continue to encourage all customers to test regularly and wear face covering as required. Additional detailed sector specic guidance will continue to be issued and we will keep you fully informed.

title: borders-records-200-coronavirus-cases-last-day
story: MORE than  cases of coronavirus have been recorded in the Borders in the last  hours, the latest figures show.The Scottish Government published updated statistics at pm today .And the data shows that the region has now seen , cases of COVID- since March last year – a rise of  since yesterday.There are  people in hospital in the Borders with recently confirmed cases of coronavirus, according to the figures – six more than yesterday.Scotland has recorded , cases since the pandemic began.

title: a7-close-two-locations-works-say-road-officials
story: THE A is set to close in two locations over the coming weeks, according to officials.The road will shut from Teviothead to the Johnnie Armstrong Gallery between .pm and am each night from Monday, January  to Friday, January  – excluding Saturday and Sunday.The A will then be closed from south of Hawick High School to Sandbed Roundabout between the same times from February  to February .:Borders primary school targeted by vandals as £.k damage caused to gardenA ersion route will be signposted between Hawick and Canonbie via the A, B and B.Tommy Deans, BEAR Scotland’s south east network manager, said: “These surfacing improvements will help to address the defects on this section of the A and will greatly improve the experience for motorists.“It is essential for safety that we close the road during these works, however we’ve arranged for the project to take place overnight to minimise the impact.“We thank motorists and the local community in advance for their patience and understanding. We’ll do all we can to complete the work as quickly and safely as possible.”

title: first-minister-announces-changes-covid-restrictions
story: A NUMBER of changes to Covid restrictions in Scotland come into effect from today .Anyone who test positive for Covid will be allowed to exit self-isolation after seven daysthey have no fever and record two negative lateral flow tests.The first of these tests must be taken on the sixth day after testing positive and then at least  hours later.In addition, household contacts of people with the virus will now be allowed to take a lateral flow test every day for seven days rather than going into self-isolation.This applies to everyone in the household under the age of  or anyone over that age who has had the first, second and booster Covid jabs.If one of these tests is positive, self-isolation will then be required.Anyone identied as a close contact who is over  and four months old and not fully vaccinated will still be asked to self-isolate for  days and take a PCR test.Restrictions, such as the limit on large scale events and closure of nightclubs, remain in place until  January.Also, people who do not have Covid symptoms but get a positive result using a lateral flow test no longer have to book a PCR test.The announcement was made by First Minister Nicola Sturgeon who told MSPs taking part in special virtual session of Holyrood yesterday that the changes are “signicant and not completely without risk”.She said: “At this stage of the pandemic they strike an appropriate balance between the continued importance of self-isolation in breaking chains of transmission, and reducing the disruption self-isolation causes in the economy and critical services.”Scottish Conservative leader Douglas Ross responded: “I welcome the U-turn on self-isolation rules, which Scottish Conservatives have been calling for since day one. We said then the policy was not sustainable.“Every other part of the United Kingdom made this change, but Scotland was left as an outlier. Why did the First Minister take so long to make this change .remove“I also welcome the changes to testing rules, which are sensible and in line with the approach across the United Kingdom.”

title: borders-peer-peer-charity-receives-1-000-donation
story: SBHA, together with Jewson Partnership Solutions , Sidey, and Keith McLean Carpets, are supporting local men’s mental health charity ANDYSMANCLUB, by donating a total of £,.The UK-wide charity has recently launched a free peer-to-peer support group for all men in the Scottish Borders, based in Galashiels.Julia Mulloy, Chief Executive at SBHA said: “SBHA is pleased to be supporting ANDYSMANCLUB which provides men in the Scottish Borders with a safe and friendly space to meet up and talk.“We recognise that, particularly at this time of year, the impact of poor mental health can be devastating for iniduals and their families.“We value the work that ANDYSMANCLUB is doing to challenge the stigma of men’s mental health by encouraging men to talk.”Jenner Millar, Partnership Account Manager – East Scotland for Jewson Partnership Solutions commented: “Giving back to our communities where we live and work is a priority for Jewson Partnership Solutions. In partnership with SBHA, we are delighted our contribution will help fund a vital service for men in the Scottish Borders.”Alex McClintock, Project Development Champion, ANDYSMANCLUB added: “A huge ANDYSMANCLUB thank you to SBHA, Jewson Partnership Solutions, Sidey and Keith McLean Carpets, for this very generous donation. This money will not only help us to grow the Galashiels Club, but also to expand further in the Borders. If you or someone you know needs someone to talk to, especially at this time of year, please reach out to ANDYSMANCLUB as we’re here to help.”

title: exciting-new-offer-live-borders
story: LIVE Borders are offering members the opportunity to join one of their online reading groups.The groups meet once a month, and there are two types of groups to choose from.Members download the selected reading group eBook from Borrowbox and the group will meet once a month to discuss their thoughts and observations.Members of the download reading group will require an eLibrary membership and access to Borrowbox to download onto their device.Members will come together to discuss their current read whether it be fiction, non-fiction, a magazine article or even a play.The group offers the opportunity to learn about dferent authors and broaden your own reading horizons.Members are given the chance to evaluate and share what they have been reading with the rest of the group.The reading groups can accommodate  people in each group and will run on the following days every month:First Monday in every month - Read Your Own Group .-. - Download Group .-.First Thursday in every month - Read Your Own Group .-. - Download Group .-.Second Thursday in every month - Download Group .-. -For more information or to enquire about availability and how to book your place email: libgalashiels@liveborders.org.uk

title: iceland-offers-50-off-favourite-brands-including-heinz-birds-eye
story: After splurging a little too much at Christmas, your bank account will thank you for shopping Icelandsup to  percent off sale. Whether youre looking to save a few pennies this January or youre looking for some inspiration in the kitchen, weve got you covered. The supermarket has slashed its prices across some of your favourite brands including Birds Eye, Comfort, Surf, Heinzand more. Weve put together a list of some of our top picks so that you dont have to go far to find a bargain. A woman shopping on her phone. Credit: PA Iceland up to  percent off sale Dolmio Bolognese Smooth Tomato Pasta SauceIceland is offering customers free pastawhen they buy When your purchase three of the Dolmio pasta sauce jarsfor just £, you can get your pasta for free. The deal includes its bolognese sauce as well as its smooth tomato sauce, tomato and cheese bake sauce and more.Shop the meal deal now.Birds Eye Chicken Dippers If youve given up on Veganuary already, these chicken dipperswill be perfect treat for you and the whole family.The -dipper bagis now half price, down from £.Pick up a bag for £..Comfort Jasmine and Strawberry Fabric Conditioner Iceland has slashed the prices of its favourite brands including Comfort. This Jasmine and Strawberry Fabric Conditioneris available for half price, down from £. You can now take on  as fresh as a daisy for just £..Iceland   percent British Beef Quarter PoundersThese  percent Beef Quarter Pounderswill make you feel like summer has come already. The four-packhas been reduced by  percent from £.. You can treat the familynow for just £.. Surf Tropical Lily  in  capsules Washing CapsulesEveryday essentials shouldnt break the bank and with Icelands up to half price sale, they dont have to.These  in  capsuleshave been reduced by  percent, down from £..Get  washesfor £..Shop the full Iceland up to  percent off sale via the Iceland website.

title: new-advice-travellers-entering-scotland
story: THE rules on pre-departure testing for travellers entering Scotland have been changed.Fully-vaccinated travellers ing to Scotland from abroad will no longer have to take pre-departure Covid tests or self-isolate upon arrival until they have received a negative result.The change in rules came into effect at am this morning. Travellers are still required to take a test on or before day two after arriving in the UK, which can be a lateral flow device rather than a PCR test. This rule comes into effect from am on Sunday morning.Anyone who tests positive on their lateral flow test will need to isolate and take a free confirmatory PCR test.The new measures apply across the UK after agreement between the UK Government and the devolved administrations in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.Transport secretary Michael Matheson said: “Given the rapid spread of Omicron last year it was essential that we took immediate steps to protect public health in Scotland, particularly with regards to international travel.“We still have signicant concerns over Omicron, but we recognise that, now it is the most dominant strain in Scotland and across the UK, it is sensible to review the measures currently in place.“We also fully understand the impact of the restrictions on staff and businesses in the travel and aviation sectors and these changes demonstrate our commitment not to keep measures in place any longer than necessary.“However, people still need to be extremely careful when travelling and to remember that both our and other countries’ Covid- requirements can change at short notice as things can evolve very quickly.“People should therefore ensure they have travel insurance and carefully check their booking terms and conditions, as well as ensuring compliance with the latest regulations for the country being visited.”

title: no-marathons-chris-raising-23-000-charity
story: BORDERER Chris Laidlaw has completed his epic  in  marathon challenge for charity – raising more than £,.The money is being shared between three organisation: the Murrayfield Injured Players Foundation Marie Curie and Alzheimer’s Scotland.The -year-old from Jedburgh set out on running one marathon each month in  on New Year’s Day and finished his selfless mission on Hogmanay.Watched by we Alanah children Struan and Ivy his dad, the former Scotland and Lions scrum-half Roy Laidlaw and a host of family and friends, Chris set out from Meggetland on a route which would take him into Edinburgh City Centre via the Union Canal.He then headed out towards Ratho before retracing his steps and looping back to Meggetland where he was given a rousing welcome by former Boroughmuir team-mates Johnny Matthews and Archie Russell among many others.“It was tough today, just over five hours,” Laidlaw, a Scottish Rugby Academy coach, said. “Knowing it was the last one and just really wanting to get to the finish made it emotional and hard.“The support today, like all the other marathons, has been unbelievable. I don’t think I would have been able to get through it without that support, so to those who ran alongside me, part of the way, or cycled, or just popped up to cheer me on, a huge thank you.”Among those who ran with Chris in the final challenge was Scottish Rugby’s welfare manager Stuart Dow, who completed his first marathon.Referee Hollie Davidson and Scotland women’s stand-off Helen Nelson joined the runners on the last section from Edinburgh’s Meadows to Meggetland.Chris added: “There’s a hot tub with my name on it that I’m desperate to get to now. Would I do any more marathons  No, not at this stage. Marathons are definitely off the script.“But what I do take from this is that when you have such a purpose, a higher purpose, to do something, then you can pretty much do anything with the right support network.”.removeLast word to dad Roy, who could not resist in joining in at stages along the route.He said: “I’m proud of him. He’s done really well, and it’s been great to see the support he’s had too.”To donate to the cause, visit: justgiving crowdfunding inin

title: borders-households-record-rise-electricity-use-data-shows
story: BORDERS households recorded their largest rise in electricity consumption in eight years in , new figures show.The majority of people were forced to spend more time at home as lockdown restrictions were introduced in an attempt to curb the spread of coronavirus.Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy figures show  Gigawatt hoursof electricity were consumed by domestic meters in the region in .This was a five per cent rise on the  GWh consumed the year before and the largest change since comparable records began in .:Spate of vandalism in Borders town sees gut-wrenching damage caused to shedFears have been raised about the soaring cost of energy bills – driven by rising gas prices – as work from home advice has been reintroduced throughout the UK.During her speech on Wednesday , First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said: “Work from home whenever possible. As the new working year gets underway, I’m appealing again to employers to enable this.”Shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves is calling on the UK Government to remove VAT on domestic gas and electricity bills through the winter months to help families weather the storm.Ms Reeves said: “Right now, people are being hit by a cost-of-living crisis which has seen energy bills soar, food costs increase and the weekly budget stretched.:Borders café owner sexually assaulted three females at his High Street business“We need a sustainable and ambitious approach to energy, which is why Labour would also ramp up ambition with our plan to retrofit  million homes, making our energy supply chain more secure without hitting household savings.”The business secretary Kwasi Kwarteng met with energy companies and regulator Ofgem after Christmas to discuss how to deal with soaring gas and electricity prices. A Government spokesman said: “Throughout the meeting there was discussion of the issues facing the sector and an agreement for meetings to continue over the coming days and weeks to ensure UK consumers are protected.”.removeAcross Great Britain electricity use by homes rose by . per cent in , but while people spent more time at home, lockdowns forced many businesses to close, with non-domestic consumption dropping by . per cent. It means overall electricity use dropped by . per cent – the largest year-on-year fall on record.

title: borders-second-online-vote-choose-next-national-park
story: BORDERERS have the chance to demonstrate their support for the region to be designated a national park in an online vote.There are currently two parks - the Cairngorms and Loch Lomond and the Trossachs - and both were created almost  years ago.The term is used to describe an area set aside by a national government for the preservation of the natural environment.It may be designated for purposes of public recreation and enjoyment or because of its historical or scientic interest. Most of the landscapes and their accompanying plants and animals in a national park are kept in their natural state.A deal between the SNP and the Scottish Green Party now means that at least one more is likely to be designated by the end of this parliamentary session.Scots Magazine has for some time supported the idea of more national parks in Scotland and have organised a vote to garner public opinion. It is not binding.Cheviots and Border Hills was one of seven potential areas suggested several years ago.The others were Ben Nevis Glen Coe Black Mount, Galloway, Coastal and Marine Park, Glen Affric, Wester Ross and Harris.Voters are asked to click on an icon of Jedburgh Abbeythey would like the Cheviots and Borders Hills to win.The vote ends on Thursday  January  and the winner will be announced on that day.At this time the region is in second place behind Galloway.John Mayhew, who ran Scottish Campaign for National Parks, is in no doubt about the value of adding to the existing parks, the Cairngorms and Loch Lomond  The Trossachs.He said: “They bring real focus, as well as additional resources to help support the area’s natural and cultural heritage.”Vote here: https:www.scotsmagazine nationalparks

title: coronavirus-borders-map-shows-areas-new-cases
story: A MAP shows which areas of the Borders have seen the most cases of coronavirus in recent days.The Public Health Scotland tool breaks the region down into  neighbourhoods.Data on the number of COVID- cases recorded and the case rate per , in the seven-day period from December  to January  is shown.All  Borders neighbourhoods are currently in the highest category – more than  per , – for case rate.:Borders café owner sexually assaulted three females at his High Street businessTweeddale East recorded the most cases during the seven-day period with , at a rate of ,..Ettrick, Yarrow and Lilliesleaf, and Cheviot West both recorded the lowest number of cases with , at respective rates of ,. and ,..The highest rate was seen in Galashiels North, with the  cases giving the area a rate of ,..As well as the lowest number of cases, Cheviot West also recorded the lowest rate per ,.To view the map, click hereand then select cases by neighbourhood.

title: aldi-middle-aisle-equipment-spruce-home-gym-space---see-fitness-deals
story: Aldi has some exciting new itemsand they could help you create the home gym of dreams.Whether you’re already a fitness fanaticor you’re looking to give exercise a go, we think we have just what you need for those days when you don’t want to leave the house. It happens to the best of us!While you might’ve been hoping to only buy your weekly essentials from Aldi,beware that a browse on the websitecould end with a few unexpected items being added to your online shopping basket.We’ve listed some home exercise equipmentthat you can pre-order online now.Items listed here are only available to buy onlineso they wont be making an appearance in your local Aldi store.Crane Rowing Machine" alt"Border : Crane Rowing Machine " class"editor-image"Crane Rowing MachineGet those reps in with this rowing machineand adapt the resistance levels to suit your workout.Not only is this exercise machinecomfortable to use but it also tracks your progress including your heart rate and theof time you train for.This machine costs £. and you can pre-order via the Aldi website here.Crane Dumbell Set  Storage Tree" alt"Border : Crane Dumbell Set  Storage Tree " class"editor-image"Crane Dumbell Set  Storage TreeIf weights are more your thing, this dumbell setmight be just what your at-home gym needs.Keep all  of them neatly stored away on this storage tree,making more room for other gym equipment.The dumbells come in a iety of weightsso you can get the most out of your workout.It could be yours for £. and you can pre-order via the Aldi website here.Crane Exercise Bike" alt"Border : Crane Exercise Bike " class"editor-image"Crane Exercise BikeWith this bike,you don’t have to worry about the weather letting you down when it’s time to go cycling.From your own gym space,you’ll be warm and dry inside but still getting the job done.With a space to put your water bottle, tablet and towel, you’ll be well away.The biketracks your speed, heart rate and distance plus more of your progress.This exercise bike costs £. and you can pre-order via the Aldi website here.

title: view-1921-census-via-findmypast-free
story: The  census has now been released to the public after the documents were sealed for more than  years.The censusholds details about how our ancestors lived and workedin the wake of the First World Warand the Spanish flu pandemic.Taken on June , , the records hold information about nearly  million people who lived in England and Wales during a period of economic turmoiland when women had just won the right to vote.Heres what you need to know about viewing the censusonline and in libraries.How to view the  census onlineThe censusis available online at findmypastas well as in person at the National Archives in Kew, the National Library of Wales in Aberystwyth, and the Manchester Central Library.Findmypastsaid the Censuswill not immediately be free to view - but you can access it via any subscription, including libraries. Hi again, the free search will show birth place, birth location, full name and location of census, and a hover-over preview will indicate other names in the household, so we hope you can be confident with your purchase 🙂— FindmypastJanuary , It will only be available via pay-per-view accessfor the initial period, Findmypastsaid.Viewing transcriptionscosts £. per record while records can also be viewed as an image of the original document, viewing imagescosts £. per record.-month Pro subscribers via Findmypastcan access a  per cent discount on all  Census purchases, according to Findmypast.How can I view the  census for free Visitors to The National Archives in Kew will be able to view the  Census online for free via the Findmypast website, the National Archives said.This also applies to two regional hubs at Manchester Central Library and the National Library of Wales - access will be supported by the Manchester and Lancashire Family History Society helpdesk and the Archives+ Team..removeControversial pay-per-view census decisionSome historians have raised concerns over pay-per-view access to the  census while others looking to analyse their family history complained online.One Twitter user said: "A bit misleading to advertise about the  census records, but not that theyre pay-per-view only. I get that its an expensive exercise to digitize, but be upfront and transparent."Another added: "My great grandfathers handwriting has just cost me a fortune in @findmypast costs. Well, that and the poor name iants option. Why isnt the #Census free to access  This is public information. I spot another great inequality."Catherine Warr, the historianbehind YouTube channel Yorkshires Hidden History, said it was important to make "history accessible to all".The historiansaid: "As a working-class, non-academic historian, Im passionate about making history accessible to all."Whilst there are costs involved in digitising census records and it does involve a lot of work, all that keeping these records behind a paywall does is make it harder for historians and family researchers from lower economic backgrounds to access this information."The Welsh Newspaper Archive has managed to make millions of newspapers, from the th century to , free for everyone to access, demonstrating that keeping information behind a paywall is a choice, not an obligation.near Southampton. " alt"Border : Undated handout photo issued by Findmypast Tanya Nakamoto, a Findmypast conservator pushing a trolley of boxes containing some of the , bound volumes of the  Census, which take up . linear kilometres of shelving, at the Office for National Statisticsnear Southampton. " class"editor-image"Undated handout photo issued by Findmypast Tanya Nakamoto, a Findmypast conservator pushing a trolley of boxes containing some of the , bound volumes of the  Census, which take up . linear kilometres of shelving, at the Office for National Statisticsnear Southampton."If we want to make sure that genealogy and historical research is a welcoming and open hobby for all, we must make it easier for all people to access records - and that means making them free."Why isnt the  census free Findmypastsaid it had made a "signicant investment" in "conserving, digitising, transcribing and building an experience that enables meaningful, accurate searches" of the census.The  census saw teams from Findmypastand the National Archives carefully digitise more than , bound volumes of original documents, all stored on . linear kilometres of shelving. Speaking via the Findmypast website, Findmypast said: "Every page of the fragile physical documents had to be handled by a trained conservation technician who was responsible for a iety of delicate tasks, including removing any objects that could damage the paper, correcting folds covering the text, teasing apart pages that had become stuck together, restoring tears and checking for and repairing other damage."

title: platinum-jubilee-fund-opens-borders-communities
story: APPLICATIONS for the Queens Platinum Jubilee Fund through Scottish Borders Councilare now open.The fund was launched to help communities commemorate the Queens Platinum Jubilee, marking  years on the throne.Non-profit community groups and voluntary groups can apply for the grant to cover the cost of events and gatherings across the region – grants of up to £, are available and a maximum of £, could be given to larger projects.:Coronavirus: Borders recorded zero deaths in lead-up to new year, data showsCouncillor Robin Tatler, executive member for community development and localities, said: “The Queen’s Platinum Jubilee Fund is a brilliant initiative to celebrate and reflect on the service of Her Majesty over the last  years.”There will also be an extended bank holiday from Thursday, June  to Sunday, June  to mark the jubilee.Applicants to the fund are encouraged to be as creative as possible, with suggested events including concerts, open days, or street parties.The funding could also be used to "create a lasting legacy" by improving public spaces including parks, gardens or by planting commemorative trees in the community.:Spate of vandalism in Borders town sees gut-wrenching damage caused to shedMr Tatler added: “This is a great opportunity to harness the community spirit our towns and villages in the Borders are renowned for, following a dficult couple of years dealing with the impact of coronavirus.“I urge as many communities and organisations as possible to participate in creating a lasting legacy of the Queen’s Platinum Jubilee and fill out an application form.”To apply and for more information, visit: www.scotborders.gov.uk JubileeFund

title: southampton-overcome-early-red-card-earn-fa-cup-win-swansea
story: Southampton survived the first-half dismissal of Yan Valery to reach the fourth round of the FA Cup with a - extra-time win at Swansea.The Saints spent a full  minutes down to  men, but goals from Nathan Redmond, Mohamed Elyounoussi and Shane Long saw them progress from a tie played behind closed doors because of the Welsh Government’s coronavirus regulations.Joel Piroe had brought parity after  minutes before Jan Bednarek’s own goal briefly put Swansea ahead in extra time.The lack of a crowd did not favour Championship side Swansea, who were unable to unsettle slick Premier League opponents during a one-sided opening.Valery’s second dismissal in English football offered Swansea encouragement, but Southampton – FA Cup semi-finalists last season – showed enormous character to fuel hopes of another productive run in the competition.Swansea had not played since December  because of Covid- both in their squad and opposition camps.There was little sign of rust as Liam Walsh, making a first home start since his summer arrival, fizzed a -yard shot just wide of the target.Valery was subsequently booked for bringing down Ryan Manning during that move and the late challenge would come back to haunt the French full-back.Redmond had not scored since Southampton’s record - Carabao Cup win at nearby Newport in August.But Redmond finished confidently after Nathan Tella celebrated his new Saints contract by intercepting Walsh’s pass and finding the forward with a measured pass.Southampton dominated possession and Valery, prominent down the right flank, saw an angled effort deflected over Ben Hamer’s goal.But the complexion of the tie changed on the half-hour mark when Valery was caught out by Liam Cullen’s diagonal ball.Valery thrust out an arm to block the run of former Saints striker Michael Obafemi and referee Simon Hooper considered the act worthy of a second yellow card.Saints skipper James Ward-Prowse dropped back to fill Valery’s right-back role and Swansea seized control before the break..removePiroe’s deflected attempt was comfortably gathered by Fraser Forster and Kyle Naughton and Flynn Downes skied over.Southampton defended resolutely at the start of the second period and should have been ahead just before the hour.Ward-Prowse floated a free-kick to the far post and the unmarked Jack Stephens sent his header wide of the upright.Swansea had created little but were level when Naughton broke behind the visitors’ defence. His cross fell kindly to Piroe and the Dutch striker blasted his th goal of the season into the roof of the Saints net.Forster saved Southampton in the final minute by sticking out a foot to deny Piroe, but the giant goalkeeper had no chance four minutes into extra time when Bednarek erted Olivier Ntcham’s effort past him.The lead lasted less than  seconds as Long set up fellow substitute Elyounoussi and the Swansea defence decisively went missing again after  minutes.Ward-Prowse crossed and this time Long was the unmarked beneficiary to seal Southampton’s fth win from their last six visits to Swansea and a place in the last  of the FA Cup..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Southampton overcome early red card to earn FA Cup win at Swansea

title: evertons-reaction-pleases-rafael-benitez-hard-fought-fa-cup-victory-hull
story: Under-fire Rafael Benitez was pleased with his players’ reaction to setbacks at Hull as Everton were made to fight for FA Cup progress.Having started the year with a deflating - home loss to Brighton in the Premier League, the Toffees won by the same scoreline after extra-time in East Yorkshire.The Championship hosts made le tough for Everton on Saturday evening, opening the scoring inside  seconds through Tyler Smith before Demarai Gray and Andre Gomes turned things around.But substitute Ryan Longman took the match into an additional  minutes before ing Andros Townsend secured a hard-fought third-round win when taking aim from  yards.“I think obviously we started with a big mistake but after, the reaction was very positive,” Everton boss Benitez said.“I was really pleased in the way that we were creating chances, chance after chance, so in football you have to take your chances.“In the FA Cup it’s even more important to do it becausenot, the other team grows in confidence and belief.“At the end, so we have a great goal from Andros Townsend but we put ourselves in a dficult position for a while.”Under-pressure Benitez was criticised by fans at stages of the tie, with some chants – and a banner – calling for him to leave.Askedhe was worried, the former Liverpool boss said: “No, what I said before the problems that you try to fix are coming from a time ago.“It’s not that in the last three months we have dferent issues, so the issues are similar and you try to fix that.“I have experience to do it. I will try to do my best.“If some fans understand that, they will support the team. That is the main thing, to stay behind the team.“If they don’t understand that some of them, it’s fine, it’s up to them.“But I will continue trying to do my best, be professional and be sure that we can improve what depends on us.”Hull boss Grant McCann was proud of his side’s efforts across  minutes against Premier League opposition..remove“I’m disappointed to lose the game but in terms of the performance I was really pleased,” said the Tigers boss, who was coy when asked about Acun Ilicali’s prospective takeover.“I thought, ‘we’ve gone properly toe to toe with a Premier League team today’.“We pushed right until the end. I thought we had an equaliser at the end with Tom Eaves’ shot but it was a tremendous save fromBegovic.“All in all I’m pleased with the lads, proud of their performance and I said that to them in the changing room.“I said ‘you’ve got to be proud of yourself today because you’ve every bit matched Everton today’ but unfortunately we’ve come out on the wrong side of the result.”.push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Everton us reaction pleases Rafael Benitez in hard-fought FA Cup victory at Hull

title: southampton-facing-selection-headache-yan-valery-sees-red-swansea
story: Ralph Hasenhuttl revealed Tino Livramento may require surgery on a knee injury after his -man Southampton side claimed an extra-time FA Cup win at Swansea.Nathan Redmond, Mohamed Elyounoussi and Shane Long scored as Southampton made it to the fourth round of the competition with a - victory.The Saints played most of the game with  men after Yan Valery was sent off for two bookable offences on the half-hour mark.Saints skipper James Ward-Prowse filled in at right-back and could do so again in Tuesday’s Premier League game versus Brentford, with the suspended Valery joining Livramento and Kyle Walker-Peters on the sidelines.“I will ask my captain what he says,” Hasenhuttl said about the possibility of Ward-Prowse playing at right-back against Brentford.Teenager Livramento has been superb for Southampton since joining from Cha in a £million deal in August.The -year-old has made  Premier League appearances and last featured in the Boxing Day win at West Ham.On Livramento’s injury, Hasenhuttl said: “The meniscus injury, evenit is a light one… I know this from my own son, it was a year out.“We don’t know. At the moment we try it without surgery, but we have to look how serious it is.“It is always an alarm for me when theydon’t want to speak.“It is not good when they are not coming to me. But I will go to them every day to ask them.”The tie was played behind closed doors because of the Welsh Government’s coronavirus regulations.Hasenhuttl said: “It was a strange situation because we are not used to it anymore.“But I know that we can fight. I know we have a team with passion and high workload, but the fixtures this week now are coming very quick.“It does not get any easier with Brentford on Tuesday.”Swansea took the tie into extra time when Joel Piroe fired home his th goal of the season after  minues.Jan Bednarek’s own goal put them ahead four minutes into extra time, but Elyounoussi equalised instantly and Long’s first Saints goal since February  settled matters..removeSwansea had not played since December  because of coronavirus-enforced postponements, but this was a fourth successive defeat for Russell Martin’s side.Martin said: “I’m really hurt by the way we lost that game. It was not acceptable.“Going so long without a game has not helped, but that’s not an excuse.“We shouldn’t be conceding goals like their last two – one long kick and we’re opened up.“Our reaction to losing the ball was nowhere near good enough. But there were also some good things I liked, given the circumstances and the fact we were trying a new shape.”.push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Southampton facing selection headache after Yan Valery sees red at Swansea

title: borussia-dortmund-stage-late-comeback-frankfurt-close-gap-top
story: Borussia Dortmund staged a dramatic late comeback to win - at Eintracht Frankfurt and close the gap on Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich to six points.Bayern, depleted by Covid- cases at the club, had suffered a shock home defeat to Borussia Monchengladbach on Friday in the first game after the German top-flight’s winter break.However, it looked asDortmund would fail to take advantage after two goals from Rafael Borre saw Frankfurt lead - at half-time.⏱️  🦅⃣➖⃣💛⏱️  🦅⃣➖⃣💛An instant #Bundesligaclassic as @BlackYellowcome from behind to claim their first league win in Frankfurt since . 👏 pic uAecGGy— Bundesliga EnglishJanuary , But with  minutes left, substitute Thorgan Hazard reduced the deficit after being played in by Erling Haaland before England midfielder Jude Bellingham headed home an equaliser in the th minute.Mahmoud Dahoud then completed the dramatic turnaround when he clipped the ball into the bottom corner from  yards to secure all three points.Jonathan Tah struck a late equaliser as Bayer Leverkusen battled to a - draw at home against Union Berlin.⚫️🔴 FINAL 🔴⚫️Points shared in the BayArena. #BFCU| - | #Bundesligapic AmweVPJHH— Bayer  LeverkusenJanuary , Patrik Schick bagged his th Bundesliga goal to give the home side the lead, but Grischa Promel scored either side of the break to turn the match around before Tah headed in with six minutes left to secure the hosts a point.Hoffenheim sit third after a - win over Augsburg, with Ihlas Bebou striking twice late in the first half.A brace from Andre Silva helped RB Leipzig beat -man Mainz - at the at the Red Bull Arena.The visitors had defender Alexander Hack sent off after only  minutes for handball, resulting in a penalty which Silva dispatched..removeFinal.We gain another point.#SCFDSC| : pic JhVAiG— Arminia InternationalJanuary , Arminia Bielefeld fought back to draw - against Freiburg. The Black Forest side took an early lead through Jannik Haberer with Jeong Woo-yeong adding another at the start of the second half.Masaya Okugawa’s header reduced the deficit on the hour and substitute Bryan Lasme slotted in an equaliser with just three minutes left to edge a point closer to safety.Greuther Furth’s clash against fellow strugglers Stuttgart finished goalless.vw,vw,px, px"Vinicius Junior struck a brace at the Bernabeu Real Madrid extended their advantage at the top of LaLiga following a - home win over Valencia at the Bernabeu.Shortly before half-time, Karim Benzema broke the deadlock from the penalty spot after Casemiro had been fouled.Benzema then set up Vinicius Junior early in the second half to double the lead before the Brazilian headed in a third on the hour.Valencia pulled one back in the th minute when Goncalo Guedes nodded in the rebound after Thibaut Courtois had saved his penalty.Benzema added a late fourth for Los Blancos as Carlo Ancelotti’s men moved eight points clear of second-placed Sevilla, albeit having played two matches more., px px  rgba margin: px max-width:px min-width:px padding: width:.% width:-webkit-calc width:calc"" fill"#"View this post on InstagramtranslateY"translateX translateY width: .px flex-grow:  margin-right: px margin-left: px"translateY"translateY rotate"""translateX"A post shared by FC Barcelona Barcelona sit sixth after earlier being held to a - home win over Celta Vigo and move them level on points with third-placed Betis, who travel to Rayo Vallecano on Sunday.Bottom club Levante beat Mallorca - to finally record a first league win of the season, finishing with  men following a late red card for midfielder Jose Campana.’⚽️ BUUUUUUUUUT !!! OUI WESLEY !#RCLSRFCpic wtMArnau— Racing Club de LensJanuary , In Ligue , Wesley Said scored a last-minute winner as Lens beat Rennes - at Stade Bollaert-Delelis.Rennes – looking to close up on the Champions League places – thought they had scored on the hour, only for Gaetan Laborde to be flagged offside.Substitute Said then had the final word when his shot went in off the underside of the crossbar to send Lens up into sixth.Defending champions Lille’s match against Lorient was postponed following a Covid- outbreak in their squad..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Borussia Dortmund stage late comeback at Frankfurt to close gap at the top

title: harry-maguire-says-man-utd-deserve-criticism-must-justify-wearing-shirt
story: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire admits the team deserve recent criticism and have to show they have what it takes to pull on the shirt.The Red Devils suffered a first defeat under interim manager Ralf Rangnick with a - Premier League home defeat by Wolves on Monday night.United’s meek performance was followed by reports about a poor mood inside the dressing room, and on the back of being branded “a bunch of whinge-bags” by former defender turned TV pundit Gary Neville during half-time of the - draw at struggling Newcastle.💬 @HarryMaguiresays the dressing room is together and is determined to go on a winning run ✊🔴#MUFC— Manchester UnitedJanuary , Maguire knows the players must do better, as they prepare toto action in the third round of the FA Cup against Aston Villa on Monday night.“I’ve obviously seen a lot of criticism and a lot of is absolutely justied, but for me, with this team, it shouldn’t need criticism to motivate players,” Maguire told national newspapers, in an interview published on www.manutd.“If players of this quality aren’t motivated to play for this club when they pull the shirt on, then there’s something wrong.”Maguire added: “From what the fans and ex-players have said, we get it.“As I just said, a lot of it is justied and we all have to take massive responsibility, myself as captain as much as anyone,not more. We’ve got to start playing well and winning.“This team finished second last year and we have a better and bigger squad this year, so we have to show the right attitude.“We have big players in the team leaders.
